arabicText: الٓر ۚ كِتَـٰبٌ أَنزَلْنَـٰهُ إِلَيْكَ لِتُخْرِجَ ٱلنَّاسَ مِنَ ٱلظُّلُمَـٰتِ إِلَى ٱلنُّورِ بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطِ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْحَمِيدِ
englishTranslationText:
Alif-Lam-Ra*;	it	is	a	Book	which	We	have	
sent	 down	 upon	 you	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	
Muhammad - peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him)	 so	 that	 you	may	 bring	 forth	 people	
from	the	realms	of	darkness	into	light	- by	
the	 command	 of	 their	 Lord,	 towards	 the	
path	 of	 the	 Most	 Honourable,	 the	 Most	
Praiseworthy.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Alif-Lam-Ra*;	 ek	 Kitāb	 hai	 ke	 ham	 ne	
tumhāri	 țaraf	 utāri	 ke	 tum	 logoñ	 ko	
andheriyoñ	se	ujāle	meiñ	lāo	un	ke	Rab	ke	
hukm	se	us	ki	rāh	ki	țaraf	jo	ìzzat	wālā	sab	
khoobiyoñ	wālā	hai	.

arabicText: ٱللَّهِ ٱلَّذِى لَهُۥ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ وَوَيْلٌۭ لِّلْكَـٰفِرِينَ مِنْ عَذَابٍۢ شَدِيدٍ
englishTranslationText:
Allah - because	 all	 that	 is	 in	 the	 heavens	
and	in	the	earth	belongs	only	to	Him;	and	
woe	 is	 for	 the	 disbelievers	 through	 a	
severe	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh - ki Usi	kā	hai	jo	kuch	āsmānoñ		meiñ	
hai	aur	jo	kuch	zameen	meiñ	aur	kāfiroñ	ki	kharābi	hai	ek	sakht áƶāb	se

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ يَسْتَحِبُّونَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا عَلَى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ وَيَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَيَبْغُونَهَا عِوَجًا ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍۭ بَعِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
To	whom	the	worldly	life	is	dearer	than	the	Hereafter,	and	who	prevent	from	the	way	of	Allah
and	wish	deviations	in	it;	they	are	in	extreme	error.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jinheiñ	Ākhirat	se	dunyā	ki	zindagi	piyāri	hai	aur	Allāh	ki	rāh	se	rokte	aur	is	meiñ	kaji	(tedhapan)	
chāhte	haiñ,	woh	door	ki	gumrāhi	meiñ	haiñ

arabicText: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا بِلِسَانِ قَوْمِهِۦ لِيُبَيِّنَ لَهُمْ ۖ فَيُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهْدِى مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	 sent	every	Noble	Messenger	with	 the	 same	language	as	 his	 people	 *,	 so	 that	 he	may	
clearly	explain	to	them;	then	Allah sends	astray	whomever	He	wills,	and	He	guides	whomever	He	
wills;	 and	 He	 only	 is	 the	 Most	 Honourable,	 the	 Wise.	 (* Prophet Muhammad (peace and 
blessings be upon him) was taught all the languages as he is sent towards all.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	ne	har	Rasool us	ki	qaum	hi	ki	zabān	mein	bhejā	ke	woh	unheñ	sāf		batāye	phir	Allāh	
gumrāh	kartā	hai	jise	chāhe	aur	rāh	dikhātā	hai	jise	chāhe	aur	Wohi	Ízzat	Hikmat	wālā	hai.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مُوسَىٰ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ أَنْ أَخْرِجْ قَوْمَكَ مِنَ ٱلظُّلُمَـٰتِ إِلَى ٱلنُّورِ وَذَكِّرْهُم بِأَيَّىٰمِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّكُلِّ صَبَّارٍۢ شَكُورٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	 sent	Moosa	along	with	Our	 signs	 that,	 “Bring	 your	people	 from	 the	 realms	 of	
darkness	into	light	- and	remind	them	of	the days	of	Allah *;	indeed	in	them	are	signs	for	every	
greatly	enduring,	grateful	person.”	(* When various favours were bestowed - in order to give 
thanks and be patient.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur be-shak		Ham	ne	Mūsā ko	apni	nishāniyañ	de	kar	bhejā	ke	apni	qaum	ko	andheriyoñ	se	ujāle	
meiñ	lā	aur	unheñ	Allāh	ke	din	yād	dilā	be-shak	is	meiñ	nishāniyañ	haiñ	har	bade	sabr	wāle	shukr	
guzār	ko

arabicText: وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِ ٱذْكُرُوا۟ نِعْمَةَ ٱللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ إِذْ أَنجَىٰكُم مِّنْ ءَالِ فِرْعَوْنَ يَسُومُونَكُمْ سُوٓءَ ٱلْعَذَابِ وَيُذَبِّحُونَ أَبْنَآءَكُمْ وَيَسْتَحْيُونَ نِسَآءَكُمْ ۚ وَفِى ذَٰلِكُم بَلَآءٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ عَظِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 when	 Moosa	 said	 to	 his	 people,	
“Remember	Allah’s	favour	upon you	when	
He	rescued	you	from	the	people	of	Firaun	
who	 were	 inflicting	 you	 with	 a	 dreadful	
torment,	and	were	 slaying	 your	 sons	and	
sparing	your	daughters;	and	in	it	occurred	
a	great	favour	of	your	Lord.”*	
(* On the 10th day of Moharram - therefore 
the Jews used to fast on that day as 
thanksgiving.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jab	 Mūsā ne	 apni	 qaum	 se	 kahā	 yād	
karo	 apne	 ūpar	 Allāh	 kā	 ehsān	 jab	 us	 ne	
tumheñ	Fir’aun	wāloñ	see	najāt	di	jo	 tum	
ko	buri	mār	dete	the	aur	tumhāre	betoñ	ko	
zibah	karte	aur	 tumhāri	betiyoñ	ko	zinda	
rakhte	 aur	is	meiñ	tumhāre	Rab	 kā	 badā	
fazl	huā

arabicText: وَإِذْ تَأَذَّنَ رَبُّكُمْ لَئِن شَكَرْتُمْ لَأَزِيدَنَّكُمْ ۖ وَلَئِن كَفَرْتُمْ إِنَّ عَذَابِى لَشَدِيدٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 remember	 when	 your	 Lord	
proclaimed,	“If	you	give	thanks,	I	will	give	
you	more,	 and	if	 you	 are	 ungrateful	 then	
(know	that)	My	punishment	is	severe.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yād	karo	jab	tumhāre	Rab	ne	sunā	diyā	
ke	agar	ehsān	mānoge	to	maiñ	tumheñ	aur	
dooñ	gā	aur	agar	 nā	 shukri	 karo	 to	merā
áƶāb	sakht	hai

arabicText: وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰٓ إِن تَكْفُرُوٓا۟ أَنتُمْ وَمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًۭا فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَغَنِىٌّ حَمِيدٌ
englishTranslationText:
And	Moosa said,	“If	you	and	all	who	are	in	
the	 earth	 turn	 disbelievers,	 then	 indeed	
Allah is	 definitely	 Independent	
(Unwanting),	Most	Praiseworthy.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Mūsā ne	 kahā	 agar	 tum	 aur	 zameen			
meiñ	jitne	haiñ	sab	kāfir	ho	jāo	to	be-shak		
Allāh	be-parwāh	sab	khoobiyoñ	wālā	hai.

arabicText: أَلَمْ يَأْتِكُمْ نَبَؤُا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِكُمْ قَوْمِ نُوحٍۢ وَعَادٍۢ وَثَمُودَ ۛ وَٱلَّذِينَ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِمْ ۛ لَا يَعْلَمُهُمْ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ ۚ جَآءَتْهُمْ رُسُلُهُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ فَرَدُّوٓا۟ أَيْدِيَهُمْ فِىٓ أَفْوَٰهِهِمْ وَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا كَفَرْنَا بِمَآ أُرْسِلْتُم بِهِۦ وَإِنَّا لَفِى شَكٍّۢ مِّمَّا تَدْعُونَنَآ إِلَيْهِ مُرِيبٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Did	 not	 the	 tidings	 of	 those	 before	 you	
reach	 you?	 The	 people	 of	 Nooh,	 and	 the	
A’ad	 and	 the	 Thamud,	 and	 those	 after
them?	Only	Allah knows	them;	their	Noble	
Messengers	 came	 to	 them	 with	 clear	
proofs,	 they	 therefore	 raised	 their	 hands	
towards	their	own	mouths,	and	said,	“We	disbelieve	in	what	you	have	been	sent	with,	and	we	are	
in	a	deeply	intriguing	doubt	regarding	the path	you	call	us	to.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	tumheñ	un	ki	khabreñ	na	āayiñ	jo	tum	
se	 pahle	 	 the	 Nūh ki	 qaum	 aur Áād	 aur	
Samood aur	jo	un	ke	b’ad	huye	unheñ	Allāh	hi	jāne un	ke	Rasool un	ke	pās	raushan	dalileñ	lekar	
āaye		to	woh	apne	hāth	apne	muñh	ki	țaraf	le	gaye	aur	bole	ham	munkir	haiñ	us	ke	tumhāre	hāth	
bhejā	gayā	aur	jis	rāh	ki	țaraf	hameñ	bulāte	ho	us	meiñ	hameiñ	woh	shak	hai	ke	bāt	khulne	nahiñ	
detā.

arabicText: ۞ قَالَتْ رُسُلُهُمْ أَفِى ٱللَّهِ شَكٌّۭ فَاطِرِ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ يَدْعُوكُمْ لِيَغْفِرَ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمْ وَيُؤَخِّرَكُمْ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍۢ مُّسَمًّۭى ۚ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنْ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا بَشَرٌۭ مِّثْلُنَا تُرِيدُونَ أَن تَصُدُّونَا عَمَّا كَانَ يَعْبُدُ ءَابَآؤُنَا فَأْتُونَا بِسُلْطَـٰنٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Their	Noble	Messengers	said,	“What!	You	doubt	concerning	Allah,	the	Creator	of	the	heavens	and	
the	earth?	He	calls	you	that	He	may	forgive	some	of	your	sins	and	until	the	time	of	death	give	you	
a	life	free	from	punishment”;	they	said,	“You	are	just	human	beings	like	us;	you	wish	to	prevent	
us	from	what	our	forefathers	used	to	worship	- therefore	now	bring	some	clear	proof	to	us.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	 ke	Rasooloñ ne	 kahā:	“Kyā! Allāh	meiñ	 shak	 hai, āasmānoñ	 aur	 zameen	 kā	 banāne	 wālā?
Tumheñ	bulātā	hai	ke	 tumhāre	kuch	gunāh	bakhshe	aur	maut	ke	muqarrar	waqt	 tak	 tumhāri	
zindagi	be	áƶāb	kāt	de”; bole, “Tum	to	hamiñ	jaise	āadmi	ho; tum	chāhte	ho	ke	hameñ	us	se	b’az	
rakho	jo	hamāre	bāp	dādā	poojte	the	- ab	koi	raushan	sanad	hamāre	pās	le	āo.”

arabicText: قَالَتْ لَهُمْ رُسُلُهُمْ إِن نَّحْنُ إِلَّا بَشَرٌۭ مِّثْلُكُمْ وَلَـٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَمُنُّ عَلَىٰ مَن يَشَآءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِۦ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ لَنَآ أَن نَّأْتِيَكُم بِسُلْطَـٰنٍ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَعَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Their	Noble	Messengers	said	to	them,	“We	
are	 indeed	 human	 beings	 like	 you,	 but	
Allah bestows	 favour	upon	whomever	He	
wills,	among	His	bondmen	*;	it	is	not	our	
task	to	bring	any	proof	to	you	except	by	the	
command	 of	 Allah;	 and	 only	 upon	 Allah
must	 the	 Muslims	 rely.”	 (*	 Therefore	
Prophets	 and	 other	 men	 are	 not	 equal	 in	
status.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	ke	Rasooloñ	ne	un	se	kahā	ham	haiñ	to	
tumhāri	 țarah	 insān	 magar	 Allāh	 apne	
bandoñ	meiñ	jis par	chāhe	ehsān	 farmātā	
hai	aur	hamārā	kām	nahiñ	ke	ham	tumhāre	
pās	 kuch sanad	 le	 āayeñ magar	 Allāh	 ke	
hukm	se	aur	Musalmānoñ	ko	Allāh	hi	par	
bharosā	chāhiye

arabicText: وَمَا لَنَآ أَلَّا نَتَوَكَّلَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ وَقَدْ هَدَىٰنَا سُبُلَنَا ۚ وَلَنَصْبِرَنَّ عَلَىٰ مَآ ءَاذَيْتُمُونَا ۚ وَعَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ ٱلْمُتَوَكِّلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 what	is	 the	matter	 with	 us	 that	 we	
should	 not	 rely	 on	 Allah?	 He	 has	 in	 fact	
shown	us	our	ways;	and	we	will	surely	be	
patient	 upon	 the	 troubles	 you	 cause	 us;	
and	 those	who	 trust	must	rely	only	upon	
Allah.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hameñ	 kyā	huā	 ke	Allāh	par	bharosā	
na	 kareñ	 us	 ne	 to	 hamāri	 rāheñ	 hameñ	
dikhā	diñ	aur	 tum	jo	hameñ	satā	rahe	ho	
ham	 zaroor	 is	 par	 sabr	 kareñ	 ge	 aur	
bharosā	 karne	 wāloñ	 ko	 Allāh	 hi	 par	
bharosā	chāhiye

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِرُسُلِهِمْ لَنُخْرِجَنَّكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِنَآ أَوْ لَتَعُودُنَّ فِى مِلَّتِنَا ۖ فَأَوْحَىٰٓ إِلَيْهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ لَنُهْلِكَنَّ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 the	 disbelievers	 said	 to	 their	 Noble	
Messengers,	 “We	 will	 surely	 expel	 you	
from	 our	 land,	 unless	 you	 accept	 our
religion”;	 so	 their	 Lord	 sent	 them	 the	
divine	 revelation	 that,	 “Indeed	 We	 will	
destroy	these	unjust	people.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kāfiroñ	ne	apne	Rasooloñ	se	kahā	ham	
zaroor	 tumheñ	apni	 zameen se	 nikāl	 deñ	
ge	yā	tum	hamāre	deen	par	ho	jāo	to	unheñ	
un	ke	Rab	ne	waḥi	bheji	ke	ham	zaroor	un	
zālimoñ	ko	halāk	kareñ	ge

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِرُسُلِهِمْ لَنُخْرِجَنَّكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِنَآ أَوْ لَتَعُودُنَّ فِى مِلَّتِنَا ۖ فَأَوْحَىٰٓ إِلَيْهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ لَنُهْلِكَنَّ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	indeed	We	will	establish	 you	in	 the	
land	after	them;	this	is	for	him	who	fears	to	
stand	before	Me	and	 fears	the	commands	
of	punishment	declared	by	Me.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	zaroor	ham	tum	ko	un	ke	b’ad	zameen			
meiñ	basāyeñ	ge	yeh	us	ke	liye	hai	jo	mere	huzoor	khade	hone	se	dare	aur	maiñ	ne	jo	áƶāb	kā	
hukm	sunāyā	hai	us	se	khauf	kare

arabicText: وَٱسْتَفْتَحُوا۟ وَخَابَ كُلُّ جَبَّارٍ عَنِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText: And	they	sought	a	decision,	and	every	stubborn	rebel	was	destroyed.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	unhoñ	ne	faislā	māñgā	aur	har	sarkash	hat	dharam	nā	murād	hu

arabicText: مِّن وَرَآئِهِۦ جَهَنَّمُ وَيُسْقَىٰ مِن مَّآءٍۢ صَدِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Hell	went	after	him,	and	he	will	be	made	to	drink	liquid	pus	*.	(*	Discharged	from	the	wounds	of	
other	people	in	hell.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Jahannam	us	ke	piche	lagi	aur	usey		peep	kā	pāni	pilāyā	jayegā

arabicText: يَتَجَرَّعُهُۥ وَلَا يَكَادُ يُسِيغُهُۥ وَيَأْتِيهِ ٱلْمَوْتُ مِن كُلِّ مَكَانٍۢ وَمَا هُوَ بِمَيِّتٍۢ ۖ وَمِن وَرَآئِهِۦ عَذَابٌ غَلِيظٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
He	will	sip	it	with	difficulty	but	be	unable	to	swallow,	and	death	will	approach	him	from	every	
side	and	he	will	not	die;	and	a	severe	punishment	is	after	him.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ba-mushkil	us	kā	thodā	thodā	ghooñt	legā	aur	gale	se	niche	utārne	ki	ummid	na	hogi	aur	usey		
har	țaraf	se	maut	āaye	gi	aur	maregā	nahiñ	aur	us	ke	piche	ek	gārdhā áz	āb

arabicText: يَتَجَرَّعُهُۥ وَلَا يَكَادُ يُسِيغُهُۥ وَيَأْتِيهِ ٱلْمَوْتُ مِن كُلِّ مَكَانٍۢ وَمَا هُوَ بِمَيِّتٍۢ ۖ وَمِن وَرَآئِهِۦ عَذَابٌ غَلِيظٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
He	will	sip	it	with	difficulty	but	be	unable	to	swallow,	and	death	will	approach	him	from	every	
side	and	he	will	not	die;	and	a	severe	punishment	is	after	him.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ba-mushkil	us	kā	thodā	thodā	ghooñt	legā	aur	gale	se	niche	utārne	ki	ummid	na	hogi	aur	usey		
har	țaraf	se	maut	āaye	gi	aur	maregā	nahiñ	aur	us	ke	piche	ek	gārdhā áz	āb

arabicText: مَّثَلُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِرَبِّهِمْ ۖ أَعْمَـٰلُهُمْ كَرَمَادٍ ٱشْتَدَّتْ بِهِ ٱلرِّيحُ فِى يَوْمٍ عَاصِفٍۢ ۖ لَّا يَقْدِرُونَ مِمَّا كَسَبُوا۟ عَلَىٰ شَىْءٍۢ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلضَّلَـٰلُ ٱلْبَعِيدُ
englishTranslationText:
The	state	of	those	who	disbelieve	in	their	Lord	is	that	their	deeds	are	like	ashes	which	the	strong	
wind	blew	away	on	a	stormy	day;	they	got	nothing	from	all	that	they	earned;	this	is	the	extreme	
error.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Apne	Rab	se	munkiroñ	kā	hāl	aisā	hai	ke	un	ke	kām	haiñ	jaise	rākh	ke	us	par	hawā	ka	sakht	jhoñkā	
āayā	āañdhi	ke	din	meiñ	sāri	kamāi	meiñ	se	kuch hāth	na	lagā	yahi	hai	door	ki	gumrāhi

arabicText: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ إِن يَشَأْ يُذْهِبْكُمْ وَيَأْتِ بِخَلْقٍۢ جَدِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Have	 you	not	seen	 that	Allah has	created	
the	 heavens	 and	 the	 earth	 with	 true	
purpose?	If	He	wills,	He	can	remove	you	all	
and	bring	a	new	creation.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	tu	ne	na	dekhā	ke	Allāh	ne	āasmān-ozameen	Haq	ke	sath	banāye	agar	chāhe	to	
tumheñ	 le	 jāye	 aur	 ek	 nayi	 makhlooq	 le	
āaye

arabicText: وَمَا ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ بِعَزِيزٍۢ
englishTranslationText: And	this	is	not	at	all	difficult	for	Allah.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	yeh	Allāh	par	kuchh		dushwār	nahiñ.

arabicText: وَبَرَزُوا۟ لِلَّهِ جَمِيعًۭا فَقَالَ ٱلضُّعَفَـٰٓؤُا۟ لِلَّذِينَ ٱسْتَكْبَرُوٓا۟ إِنَّا كُنَّا لَكُمْ تَبَعًۭا فَهَلْ أَنتُم مُّغْنُونَ عَنَّا مِنْ عَذَابِ ٱللَّهِ مِن شَىْءٍۢ ۚ قَالُوا۟ لَوْ هَدَىٰنَا ٱللَّهُ لَهَدَيْنَـٰكُمْ ۖ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيْنَآ أَجَزِعْنَآ أَمْ صَبَرْنَا مَا لَنَا مِن مَّحِيصٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
They	will	all	publicly	come	in	the	presence	
of	Allah - then	 those	who	were	weak	will	
say	 to those	 who	 were	 the	 leaders,	 “We	
were	your	followers	- is	it	possible	for	you	
to	avert	some	of	Allah’s	punishment	from	
us?”	They	will	answer,	“If	Allah had	guided	
us,	 we	 would	 have	 guided	 you;	 it	 is	 the	
same	for	us,	whether	we	panic	or	patiently	
endure	- we	 have	 no	 place	 of	 refuge.”	(*	
This	 conversation	 will	 take	 place	 between	
the	disbelievers	and	their	leaders.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	sab	Allāh	ke	huzoor álāniyah	hāzir	hoñ	
ge	 to	 jo	 kamzor	 the	 woh	 badāi	 wāloñ	 se	
kaheñ	ge	ham	 tumhāre	 tābe’	 the	kyā	 tum	
se	 ho	 saktā	 hai	 ke	 Allāh	 ke áƶāb	meiñ	 se	
kuchh	 	 ham	 par	 se	 tāl	 do	 kaheñ	 ge	 Allāh	
hameñ	hidāyat	kartā	to	ham	tumheñ	karte	
ham	par	ek	sā	hai	chāhe	be	qarāri	kareñ	yā	
sabr	se	raheñ	hameñ	kahiñ	panāh	nahiñ.

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ لَمَّا قُضِىَ ٱلْأَمْرُ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ وَعَدَكُمْ وَعْدَ ٱلْحَقِّ وَوَعَدتُّكُمْ فَأَخْلَفْتُكُمْ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ لِىَ عَلَيْكُم مِّن سُلْطَـٰنٍ إِلَّآ أَن دَعَوْتُكُمْ فَٱسْتَجَبْتُمْ لِى ۖ فَلَا تَلُومُونِى وَلُومُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَكُم ۖ مَّآ أَنَا۠ بِمُصْرِخِكُمْ وَمَآ أَنتُم بِمُصْرِخِىَّ ۖ إِنِّى كَفَرْتُ بِمَآ أَشْرَكْتُمُونِ مِن قَبْلُ ۗ إِنَّ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 Satan	 will	 say	 when	 the	 matter	 has	
been	decided,	“Indeed	Allah had	given	you	
a	 true	 promise	- and	 the	 promise	 I	 gave	
you,	I	made	it	untrue	to	you;	and	I	had	no	
control	 over	 you	 except	 that	 I	 called	 you	
and	you	obeyed	me;	so	do	not	accuse	me,	
blame	only	yourselves;	neither	can	 I	help	
you,	 nor can	 you	 help	 me;	 I	 have	 no	
concern	 with	 your	 ascribing	 me	 as	 a	
partner	(to	Allah);	indeed	for	the	unjust	is	a	painful	punishment.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	shaițān	kahegā	jab	 faislā	ho	chuke	gā	
be-shak	 	 Allāh	 ne	 tum	 ko	 sachchā	 w’adā	
diyā	thā	aur	maiñ	ne	jo	tum	ko	w’adā	diyā	
thā	woh	maiñ	ne	tum	se	jhootā	kiyā	aur	merā	tum	par	kuchh		qāboo	na	thā	magar	yahi	ke	maiñ	
ne	tum	ko	bulāyā	tum	ne	meri	mān	li	to	ab	mujh	par	ilzām	na	rakho	khud	apne	ūpar	ilzām	rakho	
na	maiñ	tumhāri	faryād	ko	pahuñch	sakooñ	na	tum	meri	faryād	ko	pahuñch	sako	woh	jo	pahle		
tum	ne	mujhe	shareek	thahrāyā	thā	maiñ	us	se	sakht	bezār	hooñ	be-shak	zālimoñ	ke	liye	dardnāk áƶāb	hai

arabicText: وَأُدْخِلَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ جَنَّـٰتٍۢ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِمْ ۖ تَحِيَّتُهُمْ فِيهَا سَلَـٰمٌ
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who	believed	and	did	good	deeds	will	be	admitted	into	Gardens	beneath	which	rivers	
flow,	abiding	in	it	forever,	by	the	command	of	their	Lord;	their	greeting	in	it	is	“Peace”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	jo	Imān laye	aur	achche	kām	kiye	woh	bāghoñ	meiñ	dākhil	kiye	jayeñ	ge	jin	ke	niche	
nehreñ	rawāñ	hamesha	un	meiñ	raheñ	apne	Rab	ke	hukm	se	us	meiñ	un	ke	milte	waqt	kā	ikrām	
salām	hai.

arabicText: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ ضَرَبَ ٱللَّهُ مَثَلًۭا كَلِمَةًۭ طَيِّبَةًۭ كَشَجَرَةٍۢ طَيِّبَةٍ أَصْلُهَا ثَابِتٌۭ وَفَرْعُهَا فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ
englishTranslationText:
Did	you	not	see	how	Allah illustrated	the	example	of	a	sacred	saying?	Like	a	sacred	tree,	which	
has	firm	roots	and	branches	reaching	into	heaven.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	tum	ne	na	dekhā	Allāh	ne	kaisi	misāl	bayān	farmāi	pākiza	bāt	ki	jaise	pakiza	darakht	jis	ki	jad	
qāim	aur	shākheñ	āsmān	meiñ.

arabicText: تُؤْتِىٓ أُكُلَهَا كُلَّ حِينٍۭ بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهَا ۗ وَيَضْرِبُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْأَمْثَالَ لِلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Bearing	fruit	at	all	times by	the	command	
of	its	Lord;	and	Allah illustrates	examples	
for	people	so	that	they	may	understand.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Har	waqt	apnā	phal	detā	hai	apne	Rab	ke	
hukm	 se	 aur	 Allāh	 logoñ	 ke	 liye	 misāleñ	
bayān	farmātā	hai	ke	kahiñ	woh	samjheñ

arabicText: وَمَثَلُ كَلِمَةٍ خَبِيثَةٍۢ كَشَجَرَةٍ خَبِيثَةٍ ٱجْتُثَّتْ مِن فَوْقِ ٱلْأَرْضِ مَا لَهَا مِن قَرَارٍۢ ٢٦
englishTranslationText:
And	 the	example	of	a	bad	saying	is	like	a	
filthy	 tree,	 which	 is	 cut	 off	 above	 the	
ground,	therefore	not	having	stability.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	gandi	bāt	ki	misāl	jaise	ek	ganda	perd	
ke	zameen	ke	ūpar	se	kāt	diyā	gayā	ab	usey		
koi	qiyām	nahiñ

arabicText: يُثَبِّتُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِٱلْقَوْلِ ٱلثَّابِتِ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَفِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۖ وَيُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ ۚ وَيَفْعَلُ ٱللَّهُ مَا يَشَآءُ
englishTranslationText:
Allah keeps	 the	 believers	 firm	 upon	 the	
truth	 in	 the	 life	 of	 this	 world	 and	 in	 the	
Hereafter;	 and	 Allah sends	 the	 unjust	
astray;	 and	 Allah may	 do	 whatever	 He	
wills.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	sābit	rakhtā	hai	Imān wāloñ	ko	haq	
bāt	par	dunyā	ki	zindagi	meiñ	aur	āakhirat		
meiñ	 aur	 Allāh	 zālimoñ	 ko	 gumrāh	 kartā	
hai	aur	Allāh	jo	chāhe	kare

arabicText: ۞ أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَى ٱلَّذِينَ بَدَّلُوا۟ نِعْمَتَ ٱللَّهِ كُفْرًۭا وَأَحَلُّوا۟ قَوْمَهُمْ دَارَ ٱلْبَوَارِ
englishTranslationText:
Did	you	not	see	those	who	exchanged	the	
grace	 of	Allah for	 ungratefulness	 and	led	
their	 people	 down	 to	 the	 home	 of	
destruction?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	 tum	 ne	 unheñ	 na	 dekhā	 jinhoñ	 ne	
Allāh	ki	ne’amat	nā	shukri	se	badal	di	aur	
apni	qaum	ko	tabāhi	ke	ghar	lā	utārā

arabicText: جَهَنَّمَ يَصْلَوْنَهَا ۖ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْقَرَارُ
englishTranslationText:
Which	is	hell;	they	will	enter	it;	and	what	a	
wretched	place	of	stay!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jo	 dozakh	 hai	 us	 ke	andar	 	jāyeñ	ge	
aur	kyā	hi	buri	thaharne	ki	jagah

arabicText: وَجَعَلُوا۟ لِلَّهِ أَندَادًۭا لِّيُضِلُّوا۟ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ ۗ قُلْ تَمَتَّعُوا۟ فَإِنَّ مَصِيرَكُمْ إِلَى ٱلنَّارِ
englishTranslationText:
And	 they	 ascribed	 equals	 to	 Allah to	
mislead	from	His	way;	say,	“Enjoy	a	while,	
for	your	end	will	be	the	fire.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	ke	liye	barābar	wāle	thahrāye	ke	
us	ki	rāh se	bahkā	deñ	tum	farmāo	kuchh		barat	lo	ke	tumhārā	anjām	āag	hai

arabicText: قُل لِّعِبَادِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ يُقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَيُنفِقُوا۟ مِمَّا رَزَقْنَـٰهُمْ سِرًّۭا وَعَلَانِيَةًۭ مِّن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِىَ يَوْمٌۭ لَّا بَيْعٌۭ فِيهِ وَلَا خِلَـٰلٌ
englishTranslationText:
Say	to	the	bondmen	of	Mine	who	believe,	
that	they	must	keep	the	prayer	established	
and	spend	in	Our	way	from	what	We	have	
given	 them,	 secretly	 and	 publicly,	 before	
the	advent	of	a	day	in	which	there	will	be	no	trade	nor	friendship.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mere	un	bandoñ	se	farmāo	jo	Imān lāye	ke	Namāz	qāim	rakheñ	aur	hamāre	diye	meiñ	se	kuchh		
hamāri	rāh	meiñ	chupe	aur	zahir	kharch	kareñ	us	din	ke	āane	se	pahle		jis	meiñ	nā	saudāgari	hogi	
na	yārāna

arabicText: ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَأَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ فَأَخْرَجَ بِهِۦ مِنَ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ رِزْقًۭا لَّكُمْ ۖ وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ ٱلْفُلْكَ لِتَجْرِىَ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ بِأَمْرِهِۦ ۖ وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	Allah Who	created	the	heavens	and	the	earth,	and	sent	down	water	from	the	sky,	therefore	
producing	some	fruits	for	you	to	eat;	and	subjected	the	ships	for	you,	that	they	may	sail	upon	the	
sea	by	His	command;	and	subjected	the	rivers	for	you.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	hai	jis	ne	āasmān	aur	zameen	banāye	aur	āasmān	se	pani	utārā	to	us	se	kuchh		phal	tumhāre	
khāne	ko	paidā	kiye	aur	tumhāre	liye	kashti	ko	musakhkhar	kiyā	ke	us	ke	hukm	se	dariyā	meiñ	
chale	aur	tumhāre	liye	nadiyāñ	musakhkhar	kiñ

arabicText: وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ ٱلشَّمْسَ وَٱلْقَمَرَ دَآئِبَيْنِ ۖ وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ
englishTranslationText:
And	subjected	the	sun	and	the	moon	for	you,	which	are	constantly	moving;	and	has	subjected	the	
night	and	the	day	for	you.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tumhāre	liye	sooraj	aur	chāñd	musakhkhar	kiye	jo	barābar	chal	rahe	haiñ	aur	tumhāre	liye	
rāt	aur	din	musakhkhar	kiye

arabicText: وَءَاتَىٰكُم مِّن كُلِّ مَا سَأَلْتُمُوهُ ۚ وَإِن تَعُدُّوا۟ نِعْمَتَ ٱللَّهِ لَا تُحْصُوهَآ ۗ إِنَّ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ لَظَلُومٌۭ كَفَّارٌۭ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 tumheñ	 bahut	 kuchh	 muñh	 māñgā	
diyā	 aur	 agar	 Allāh	 ki	 ne’amateñ	 gino	 to	
shumār	na	kar	sakoge	be-shak		āadmi	badā	
zālim	badā	nā	shukrā	hai

arabicText: وَإِذْ قَالَ إِبْرَٰهِيمُ رَبِّ ٱجْعَلْ هَـٰذَا ٱلْبَلَدَ ءَامِنًۭا وَٱجْنُبْنِى وَبَنِىَّ أَن نَّعْبُدَ ٱلْأَصْنَامَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 remember	 when	 Ibrahim	 prayed,	 “O	
my	 Lord!	 Make	 this	 town	(Mecca)	 a	 safe	
one,	and	safeguard	me	and	my	sons	 from	
worshipping	idols.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 yād	 karo	 jab	 ibrāhim	 ne árz	 ki	 aey	
mere	rab!	is	shaher	ko	amān	wālā	kar	de	
aur	 mujhe	 aur	 mere	 betoñ	 ko	 butoñ	 ke	
poojne	se	bachā

arabicText: رَبِّ إِنَّهُنَّ أَضْلَلْنَ كَثِيرًۭا مِّنَ ٱلنَّاسِ ۖ فَمَن تَبِعَنِى فَإِنَّهُۥ مِنِّى ۖ وَمَنْ عَصَانِى فَإِنَّكَ غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
“O	 my	 Lord!	 The	 idols	 have	 led	 many	
people	astray;	so	whoever	followed	me,	is	
indeed	mine;	and	whoever	disobeyed	me	-
then	 indeed	 You	 are	 Oft	 Forgiving,	 Most	
Merciful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	mere	Rab!	Be-shak		butoñ ne	bahut	log	
bahkā	diye	to	jis	ne	merā	sāth	diyā	woh	to	
merā	hai	aur	jis	ne	merā	kahā	na	mānā	to	
be-shak		tu	bakhsh	ne	wālā	meherbān		hai

arabicText: رَّبَّنَآ إِنِّىٓ أَسْكَنتُ مِن ذُرِّيَّتِى بِوَادٍ غَيْرِ ذِى زَرْعٍ عِندَ بَيْتِكَ ٱلْمُحَرَّمِ رَبَّنَا لِيُقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ فَٱجْعَلْ أَفْـِٔدَةًۭ مِّنَ ٱلنَّاسِ تَهْوِىٓ إِلَيْهِمْ وَٱرْزُقْهُم مِّنَ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَشْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“O	 our	 Lord!	 I	 have	 settled	 some	 of	 my	
descendants	 in	 a	 valley	 having	 no	
cultivation,	near	Your	Sacred	House	- O	our	
Lord!	 So	 that	 they	 may	 keep	 the	 prayer	
established,	therefore	incline	some	hearts	
of	 men	towards	 them,	 and	 provide	 them	
fruits	 to	 eat	 - perhaps	 they	 may	 be	
thankful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	mere	rab!	Maiñ	ne	apni	kuchh	aulād	ek	
nāle	meiñ	 basāi	jis	meiñ	 kheti	 nahiñ	 hoti	
Tere	hurmat	wāle	Ghar	ke	pās	aey	hamāre	
Rab!	Is	liye	ke	woh	Namāz	qāim	rakheñ	to	
tu	logoñ	ke	kuchh		dil	in	ki	țaraf	māil	kar	de	
aur	inheñ	kuchh		phal	khāne	ko	de	shāyad	
woh	ehsān	māneñ

arabicText: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّكَ تَعْلَمُ مَا نُخْفِى وَمَا نُعْلِنُ ۗ وَمَا يَخْفَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ مِن شَىْءٍۢ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ
englishTranslationText:
“O	our	Lord!	You	know	what	we	hide	and	
what	 we	 disclose;	 and	 nothing	 is	 hidden	
from	Allah,	neither	in	the	earth	nor	in	the	
heavens.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	 hamāre	 Rab!	 Tu	 jāntā	 hai	 jo	 ham	
chupāte	 haiñ	 aur	 jo	 zahir	 karte	 haiñ	 aur	
Allāh	 par	 kuchh chupā	 nahiñ zameen			
meiñ	na	āasmān	meiñ

arabicText: ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِى وَهَبَ لِى عَلَى ٱلْكِبَرِ إِسْمَـٰعِيلَ وَإِسْحَـٰقَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبِّى لَسَمِيعُ ٱلدُّعَآءِ
englishTranslationText:
“All	praise	is	to	Allah Who	gave	me	Ismail	and	Ishaq,	in	my	old	age;	indeed	my	Lord	is	the	Listener	
of	Prayer.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Sab	khoobiyāñ	Allāh	ko	jis	ne	budhāpe	meiñ	Ismāil wa	Ishāq diye	be-shak	merā	Rab	Du’ā	sun	ne	
wālā	hai

arabicText: رَبِّ ٱجْعَلْنِى مُقِيمَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةِ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِى ۚ رَبَّنَا وَتَقَبَّلْ دُعَآءِ
englishTranslationText:
“O	my	Lord!	Maintain	me	as	one	who	establishes	prayer,	and	some	of	my	descendants;	O	our	
Lord!	and	accept	my	prayer.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	mere	Rab!	Mujhe	Namāz	kā	qāim	karne	wālā	rakh	aur	kuchh	meri	aulād	ko	aey	hamāre	Rab!	
Aur	meri	du’ā	sun	le

arabicText: رَبَّنَا ٱغْفِرْ لِى وَلِوَٰلِدَىَّ وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ يَوْمَ يَقُومُ ٱلْحِسَابُ
englishTranslationText:
“O	our	Lord!	And	forgive	me,	and	my	parents,	and	all	the	Muslims	on the	day	when	the	account	
will	be	established.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	hamāre	Rab!	mujhe	bakhsh	de	aur	mere	māñ	bāp	ko	aur	sab	Musalmānoñ	ko	jis	din	hisāb	
qāim	hogā

arabicText: وَلَا تَحْسَبَنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَـٰفِلًا عَمَّا يَعْمَلُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ ۚ إِنَّمَا يُؤَخِّرُهُمْ لِيَوْمٍۢ تَشْخَصُ فِيهِ ٱلْأَبْصَـٰرُ
englishTranslationText:
And	 do	 not	ever	assume	 that	Allah is	 unaware	 of	what	 the	 unjust	 do;	He	 does	 not	give	 them	
respite	but	for	a	day	in	which	the	eyes	will	become	fixed,	staring.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	har	giz	Allāh	ko	be	khabar	na	jannā	zālimoñ	ke	kām	se	unheñ	dheel	nahiñ	de	rahā	hai	magar	
aise	din	ke	liye	jis	meiñ	āañkheiñ	khuli	ki	khuli	rah	jāyeñ	gi

arabicText: مُهْطِعِينَ مُقْنِعِى رُءُوسِهِمْ لَا يَرْتَدُّ إِلَيْهِمْ طَرْفُهُمْ ۖ وَأَفْـِٔدَتُهُمْ هَوَآءٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
They	 shall	 come	 out	 running	 in	
bewilderment,	 with	 their	 heads	 raised,	
their	gaze	not	returning	to	them;	and	their	
hearts	will	not	have	any	calm
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be	 tahāshā	 daudte	 nikleñ	 ge	 apne	 sar	
uthāye	huye	ke	un	ki	palak	un	ki	țaraf	lautti	nahiñ	aur	un	ke	diloñ	meiñ	kuchh	sakat	
(țāqat)	na	hogi

arabicText: وَأَنذِرِ ٱلنَّاسَ يَوْمَ يَأْتِيهِمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ فَيَقُولُ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ رَبَّنَآ أَخِّرْنَآ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍۢ قَرِيبٍۢ نُّجِبْ دَعْوَتَكَ وَنَتَّبِعِ ٱلرُّسُلَ ۗ أَوَلَمْ تَكُونُوٓا۟ أَقْسَمْتُم مِّن قَبْلُ مَا لَكُم مِّن زَوَالٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	 warn	 the	 people	 of	 a	 day	 when	 the	
punishment	 will	 come	 upon	 them,	
therefore	the	unjust	will	say,	“O	our	Lord!	
Give	us	respite	for	a	little	while	- for	us	to	
obey	 Your	 call	 and	 follow	 the	 Noble	
Messengers”;	(It	will	be	said)	“So	had	you	
not	 sworn	 before	 that,	 ‘We	 have	 not	 to	
move	to	any	place	else	from	the	earth’?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 logoñ	 ko	 us	 din	 se	 dārāo jab	 un	 par	
áƶāb	 āye	 ga	 to	 zālim	 se	 kaheñ	 ge	 aey	
hamāre	rab!	thodi	der	hameñ	mohlat	de	ke	
ham	 terā	 bulānā	 māneñ	 aur	 Rasooloñ	 ki	
ghulāmi	kareñ	to	kyā	tum	pahle		qasam	na	
khā	 chuke	 the	 ke	 hameñ	 dunyā	 se	 kahiñ	
hat	kar	jānā	nahiñ

arabicText: وَسَكَنتُمْ فِى مَسَـٰكِنِ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ وَتَبَيَّنَ لَكُمْ كَيْفَ فَعَلْنَا بِهِمْ وَضَرَبْنَا لَكُمُ ٱلْأَمْثَالَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	you	dwelt	in	the	houses	of	those	who	
had	 wronged	 themselves	 and	 it	 became	
very	clear	 to	 you	how	We	had	dealt	with	
them,	and	We	illustrated	several	examples	
for	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tum	un	ke	gharoñ	meiñ	base	jinhoñ	ne	
apnā	burā	kiyā	thā	aur	tum	par	khoob	khul	
gayā	ham	ne	un	ke	sāth	kaisā	kiyā	aur	ham	
ne	tumheñ	misāleñ	de	de	kar	batā	diyā

arabicText: وَقَدْ مَكَرُوا۟ مَكْرَهُمْ وَعِندَ ٱللَّهِ مَكْرُهُمْ وَإِن كَانَ مَكْرُهُمْ لِتَزُولَ مِنْهُ ٱلْجِبَالُ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	they	carried	out	their	scheme,	
and	 their	 scheming	 is	 within	 Allah’s	
control;	 and	 their	 scheme	 was	 not	 such	
that	could	move	these	mountains	*.	(* The 
revelations / signs of Allah.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 be-shak	 woh	 apnā	 sā	 dāoñ	 (fareb)	
chale	aur	un	kā	dāoñ	Allāh	ke	qāboo	meiñ	
hai	aur	un	kā	dāoñ	kuchh		aisā	na	thā	ke	jis
se	yeh	pahād	tal	jāyeñ

arabicText: فَلَا تَحْسَبَنَّ ٱللَّهَ مُخْلِفَ وَعْدِهِۦ رُسُلَهُۥٓ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَزِيزٌۭ ذُو ٱنتِقَامٍۢ
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 har	 giz	 yeh	 khayāl	 na	 karnā	 ke	 Allāh	
apne	Rasooloñ	se	w’adā	khilāf		kare	gā	beshak	Allāh	ghālib	hai	badlā	lene	w

arabicText: يَوْمَ تُبَدَّلُ ٱلْأَرْضُ غَيْرَ ٱلْأَرْضِ وَٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتُ ۖ وَبَرَزُوا۟ لِلَّهِ ٱلْوَٰحِدِ ٱلْقَهَّارِ
englishTranslationText:
On	the	day	when	the	earth	will	be	changed	to	other	than	this	earth,	and	the	heavens	- and	they	
will	all	come	forth	standing	before	Allah,	the	One,	the	Dominant	above	all.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	din	badal	di	jāye	gi	zameen	is	zameen	ke	siwā	aur	āasmān	aur	log	sab	nikal	khade	hoñ	ge	ek	
Allāh	ke	sāmne	jo	sab	par	ghālib	hai

arabicText: وَتَرَى ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ مُّقَرَّنِينَ فِى ٱلْأَصْفَادِ
englishTranslationText: And	on	that	day	you	will	see	the	guilty	linked	together	in	chains.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	us	din	tum	mujrimoñ	ko	dekho	ge	ke	bediyoñ	meiñ	ek	doosre	se	jude	hoñ	ge

arabicText: سَرَابِيلُهُم مِّن قَطِرَانٍۢ وَتَغْشَىٰ وُجُوهَهُمُ ٱلنَّارُ
englishTranslationText: Their	cloaks	will	be	of	pitch	and	fire	will	cover	their	faces
romanUrduTranslationText: Un	ke	kurte	rāl	ke	hoñ	ge	aur	un	ke	chahre	āg	dhāñp	le	gi.

arabicText: لِيَجْزِىَ ٱللَّهُ كُلَّ نَفْسٍۢ مَّا كَسَبَتْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَرِيعُ ٱلْحِسَابِ
englishTranslationText:
In	 order	 that	Allah may	 repay	 each	 soul	what	it	 had	 earned;	indeed	Allah spends	 no	 time	in	
judging	the	account.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Is	liye	ke	Allāh	har	jān	ko	us	ki	kamāi	kā	badlā	de	be-shak	Allāh	ko	hisāb	karte	kuchh	der	nahiñ	
lagti.

arabicText: هَـٰذَا بَلَـٰغٌۭ لِّلنَّاسِ وَلِيُنذَرُوا۟ بِهِۦ وَلِيَعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّمَا هُوَ إِلَـٰهٌۭ وَٰحِدٌۭ وَلِيَذَّكَّرَ أُو۟لُوا۟ ٱلْأَلْبَـٰبِ
englishTranslationText:
This	is	the	message	to	be	conveyed	to	all	mankind	- and	in	order	to	warn	them	with	it,	and	for	
them	to	know	that	He	is	the	only	One	God,	and	for	men	of	understanding	to	heed	advice.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	logoñ	ko	hukm	pahuñchānā	hai	aur	is	liye	ke	woh	is	se	darāye	jāyeñ	aur	is	liye	ke	woh	jān	leñ	
ke	woh	ek	hi	M’abood	hai	aur	is	liye	ke áql	wāle	nasihat	māneñ
